availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Lee (Bullitt County farmer and slaveholder)

body.p: Bullitt County, Kentucky. Kentucky native. Married to L. A. Lee. Father of J. A. Lee, Charles Lee, Mallie Lee, Sophie Lee. Farmer in Bullitt County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Bullitt County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, District 3, Shepherdsville post office, p. 120.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, District 3, p. 10.
Find A Grave, Entry for Charles Lee (1815-1871), Find A Grave Memorial # 37411482, Old Cedar Grove Cemetery, Cedar Grove, Bullitt County, Kentucky, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=37411482&ref=acom (accessed 31 May 2017).
